Posts.Content: Wow Sue you have given some GREAT advice !!!!! Very good post to ALL caregivers I think. Xoxo carolyn
Posts.Title: Coping with my moms chemo for breast cancer

Posts.Content: I like the title of your thread my friend. I am a caregiver for my husband and I pray all the time for God to give me the "strength" I need to endure each day. Xoxox Carolyn
Posts.Title: Needing God's strength!

Posts.Content: On Jul 07, 2014 10:11 PM soblessedx2 wrote: Hi Carolyn,   Thank you. I just can't imagine living without faith. So blessed to turn  .  In prayer 5 times a day.  I pray that God continues to give you and your DH the strength to get through each day.  May I ask what illness your DH is living with? 2 more days till results...Hi , my husband has a blood cancer , it's cancer of the "B" cell which is the immune system. It is called waldenstroms Macroglobulinemia . I often say if I did not have faith I would have nothing. He became symptomatic in 2009 and was diagnoised with this cancer. Thank you my friend for your prayers and I am praying for you as well. God Bless, carolyn
Posts.Title: Needing God's strength!

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, when my husband was diagnosed with a rare blood cancer in 2009 I could not go to enough support groups . One nite I walked in one group and I introduced myself and said " my husband is dying with a blood cancer " well I made a huge mistake because I was corrected right away by the leader saying no " your husband is living with a blood cancer" .....and that is how all the group felt because they all had one thing in common "HOPE" !!!!!! God Bless, carolyn
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: Hi Clint, this is Carolyn. I remember you spoke of "agape" love but I cannot find that post. It was about Diana having such a love. Perhaps you could tell me alittle more about agape love . I know it is a love like no other and I remember thinking how wonderful it was to revisit a word I had forgotten so long ago. To know someone who has such love is a true blessing I think . thank you as always, Carolyn
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.
